definition: Great Leap Forward (1958-1960), Mao's attempt to modernize China's economy, which resulted in economic devastation, and millions of deaths from famine caused by misguided policies
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to jump/to leap
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: During the Great Leap Forward in 1958, people rushed headlong into mass action to establish people's communes.
sentences.chinese: 一九五八年“大跃进”，一哄而起搞人民公社化。

sentences.english: Meanwhile the city continued to explode in the noonday of the country's hungry expansion.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，这座城市在国家疯狂大跃进中继续扩张。

sentences.english: Several writers for the Guardian have made what I believe is an unjustifiable leap.
sentences.chinese: 我认为，卫报的几位撰稿人来了个离谱的大跃进。

sentences.english: If we can apply that, that will be a great leap forward.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们可以对其加以应用，这将会是一次大跃进。

sentences.english: Now it plans to make a great leap forward by producing its own cars.
sentences.chinese: 如今它计划大跃进，生产自己的汽车。

sentences.english: It marks a major development in the history of Shakespearian portraiture.
sentences.chinese: 这是在莎士比亚肖像画历史上的一大跃进。

sentences.english: Its modernizing aims were dashed in the face of reality.
sentences.chinese: 大跃进的现代化目标在现实面前化为泡影。

sentences.english: The appearance of the "Great Leap Forward" broke the Movement that started not so long.
sentences.chinese: “大跃进”的出现中断了起步不久的知青运动。

sentences.english: The disaster from the Great Leap Forward and the Chinese rural people's commune movement.
sentences.chinese: 这场灾难源自大跃进和中国农村人民公社化运动。

sentences.english: Yet the Great Leap Forward was a monumental failure.
sentences.chinese: 然而，大跃进的一场令人刻骨铭心的失败。

sentences.english: The article provides three explanations to Sino-Soviet conflict, and its relation with Great Leap Forward.
sentences.chinese: 本文探讨大跃进与中苏分歧研究的三种解释。

definition: to launch a satellite/(fig.) (neologism during the Great Leap Forward, c. 1958) to achieve prominent success/(later used sarcastically) to make exaggerated claims/to talk big
Cultural Revolution (1966-1976)
collectivization of agriculture (disastrous policy of communist Russia around 1930 and China in the 1950s)
Cultural Revolution (1966-76)/abbr. for 文化大革命[Wen2 hua4 Da4 ge2 ming4]
to catch up with England and surpass the USA (economic goal)
collectivization of agriculture (under communism)
anti-rightist/abbr. for 反右派鬥爭|反右派斗争[Fan3 you4 pai4 Dou4 zheng1]
planned economy
Rectification campaign/political purge/cf Mao's 1942-44 campaign at Yanan, and his 1950 and 1957 anti-rightist purges
to work in the fields (esp. young school-leavers)/forced agricultural experience for city intellectuals
political movement
the Four Cleanups Movement (1963-66), which aimed to cleanse the politics, economy, organization and ideology of the Communist Party
revolution/revolutionary (politics)/CL:次[ci4]
collectivization/to collectivize
to reform and open to the outside world/refers to Deng Xiaoping's policies from around 1980
collectivization of agriculture (in Marxist theory)
